cycloneMessage.issuingUnit: NWS NATIONAL HURRICANE CENTER MIAMI FL
cycloneMessage.message:
ZCZC MIATCPEP2 ALL
TTAA00 KNHC DDHHMM

BULLETIN
Tropical Storm Greg Advisory Number   7
NWS National Hurricane Center Miami FL       EP072017
900 PM MDT Tue Jul 18 2017

...GREG GETS A LITTLE STRONGER...


SUMMARY OF 900 PM MDT...0300 UTC...INFORMATION
----------------------------------------------
LOCATION...14.6N 110.1W
ABOUT 490 MI...785 KM SW OF MANZANILLO MEXICO
MAXIMUM SUSTAINED WINDS...50 MPH...85 KM/H
PRESENT MOVEMENT...W OR 275 DEGREES AT 10 MPH...17 KM/H
MINIMUM CENTRAL PRESSURE...1003 MB...29.62 INCHES


WATCHES AND WARNINGS
--------------------
There are no coastal watches or warnings in effect.


DISCUSSION AND 48-HOUR OUTLOOK
------------------------------
At 900 PM MDT (0300 UTC), the center of Tropical Storm Greg was
located near latitude 14.6 North, longitude 110.1 West. Greg is
moving toward the west near 10 mph (17 km/h).  A turn toward the
west-northwest or northwest with an increase in forward speed is
forecast for the next 48 hours.

Maximum sustained winds have increased to near 50 mph (85 km/h)
with higher gusts.  Some additional strengthening is expected during
the next day or two.

Tropical-storm-force winds extend outward up to 35 miles (55 km)
from the center.

The estimated minimum central pressure is 1003 mb (29.62 inches).


HAZARDS AFFECTING LAND
----------------------
None


NEXT ADVISORY
-------------
Next complete advisory at 300 AM MDT.

$$
Forecaster Zelinsky

NNNN
